education.institution: Military Institute of Engineering, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
courses: The Military Institute of Engineering (IME) is the oldest and one of the best ranked engineering schools in Brazil, according to the Brazilian Ministry of Education

publications.name: An Adaptive Proximal ADMM for Nonconvex Linearly-Constrained Composite Programs
publications.summary: This paper develops an adaptive Proximal Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (P-ADMM) for solving linearly-constrained, weakly convex, composite optimization problems.

publications.name: The Inexact Cyclic Block Proximal Gradient Method and Properties of Inexact Proximal Maps
publications.publisher: Journal of Optimization Theory and Applications
publications.summary: This paper expands the cyclic block proximal gradient method for block separable composite minimization by allowing for inexactly computed gradients and pre-conditioned proximal maps.

publications.name: The Randomized Block Coordinate Descent Method in the H√∂lder Smooth Setting
publications.summary: This work provides the first convergence analysis for the Randomized Block Coordinate Descent method for minimizing a function that is both H√∂lder smooth and block H√∂lder smooth.

work.name: Sandia National Laboratories
work.summary: Worked on Inexact Proximal Map applied to an Inexact Trust-Region Method.
highlights: Mentors: Dr. Drew P. Kouri and Dr. Robert Baraldi.

work.name: Texas A&M University and Texas Tech University
work.summary: Working on multiple projects in large-scale optimization intended for publication in reputable optimization journals.

projects.name: Branch-and-Cut for Linear Programming
projects.summary: Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) at Texas Tech University.
highlights: worked under the advisory of Dr. Ismael R. de-Farias.
focused on exploring the Branch-and-Cut method for linear programming with multiple-choice constraints
applied CPLEX and Gurobi to implement and evaluate the algorithms developed
